Cylinder: Entity

Blue Circle: Mechanism
Transparent Circle: State Variable

Name Description Type Symbol Domain
Stake StatusThe status of staking for the actorStakeStatusType
DelegatorsThe applications which have delegated to this gatewayList[Application Entity]
POKT HoldingsThe personal holdings of the application in uPOKTuPOKT
Staked POKTThe amount that is staked by the application currently in uPOKTuPOKT

Servicer State

Name Description Type Symbol Domain
Public keyThe identifier of the nodePublic Key
Servicer SalaryA ServicerSalary is assigned to each individual Servicer based on their specific ReportCard, and is distributed every SalaryBlockFrequencyuPOKT
Report CardThe report card used when determing salary for a servicer. A ReportCard can be viewed as a rolling average of the Servicer's performance, where TestScores are removed when either TestScoreExpiration is passed or the TestScore FIFO queue exceeds MaxTestScores.Service Report Card
Test ScoresThe QoS test scoresService Test Scores
POKT HoldingsThe personal holdings of the servicer in uPOKTuPOKT
Staked POKTThe amount that is staked by the servicer currently in uPOKTuPOKT
Service URLThe API endpoint where the Web3 service is providedService URL
ServicesThe flavor(s) of Web3 hosted by this ServicerList[Service]
GeoZoneThe physical geo-location identifier this Servicer registered in. There is no formal requirement or validation (e.g. IP verification) for an actor to be physically located in the GeoZone it registers in. However, crypto-economic incentives drive actors to be registered close to where they are physically located to receive and provide the best service possible. The number of GeoZones an actor can stake for is limited to one to incentivize real geographic distribution.GeoZone
Operator Public KeyOPTIONAL; The non-custodial pubKey operating this nodePublic Key
Pause HeightThe height for which a servicer has been paused atBlock Height
Stake StatusThe status of staking for the actorStakeStatusType
Unstaking HeightThe height for which a servicer has begun unstaking at or none to represent no unstakingBlock Height

Unstaking HeightThe height for which a servicer has begun unstaking at or none to represent no unstakingBlock Height

Behavioral Action Space

Servicer Relay

A Servicer services the Application, by routing the Relay Request to the Service and forwarding the response to the Application.

Called By:

1. Servicer

Constraints:

Boundary Action Options:

1. Servicer Relay V1

Version 1 of selection policy for servicers to be using with relay.

Logic: The Servicer(s) that are paired to service an Application in a Session are equally distributed among all of the Servicers in the network. More logic can be found here: https://github.com/pokt-network/pocket-network-protocol/blob/main/utility/README.md#311-actor-selection-dispatch


Application Delegate to Gateway

An action where the application delegates to a gateway to control their on-chain actions

Called By:

1. Application

Constraints:

Gateway Registration

Registration differs from staking in the sense that the pubKey is known but there are no economic benefits/penalties in this stage of the protocol's progression. The Gateway must register on-chain in order for the Servicer to accept its signature as part of the ring. Future versions of the protocol may include on-chain rewards or penalties for the Gateway, but the current iteration will incentivize Gateways to provide a high quality, highly trusted service through free market economics.

Called By:

1. Gateway

Constraints:

Gateway Unregistration

A Gateway is able to submit an UnstakeMsg to exit and remove itself from the network. After a successful UnstakeMsg, the Gateway is no eligible sign relays on behalf of an Application. On-chain delegation from existing Applications will be removed from the world state. After the GatewayUnstakingTime unbonding time elapses, the remaining stake is returned to the Gateway's address.

Called By:

1. Gateway

Constraints:

Application Undelegation

If a staked Application wants to stop using a Gateway, and prevent the Gateway from further signing relays on its behalf, it would simply submit an on-chain UndelegateMsg. Further relays signed by the Gateway on behalf of the Application would be rejected by the Servicers.

Called By:

1. Application

Constraints:

Submit Relay Request (Gateway)

Gateway submitting a relay request on behalf of an application.

Called By:

1. Gateway

Constraints:

Control Action Space

Return Gateway Stake

After unstaking, the original stake (i.e. deposit) is returned to the Gateway's custodial account after an unbounding period has elapsed.

Constraints:

Policies

Servicer Relay Policy

The policy which determines what happens with a servicer relay including the fees. The servicer will be awarded their POKT and then either a gateway or application will be charged this POKT (depending on the session). As well, it is possible that it is the end of the session in which case the session would be removed from the global state.

Preceded By:

1. Servicer Relay

Domain Spaces:

1. Servicer Relay Space

Followed By:

1. Modify Gateway Stake

2. Modify Application Stake

3. Increase Relay Fees

4. Remove Session

5. Burn Per Relay Policy

5. Servicer Relay Space

6. Servicer Relay Space

Constraints:

Return Gateway Stake Policy

The policy which determines when a gateway can have their stake returned.

Preceded By:

1. Return Gateway Stake

Domain Spaces:

1. Return Gateway Stake Space

Followed By:

1. Update Gateway Stake Status

2. Modify Gateway POKT Holdings

3. Modify Gateway Stake

Codomain Spaces:

1. Servicer Stake Status Space

2. Modify Gateway POKT Space

3. Modify Gateway POKT Space

Constraints:

Application Delegate to Gateway Policy

Policy for determining if application is able to delegate to a gateway. The stake_per_app_delegation parameter, current stake of the gateway, and current number of delegators will be used in determining if the gateway is able to support the addition of this specific delegation.

Preceded By:

1. Application Delegate to Gateway

Domain Spaces:

1. Application Delegate to Gateway Space

Followed By:

1. Update Application Delegate

2. Add Gateway Delegator

Codomain Spaces:

1. Application Delegate to Gateway Space

2. Application Delegate to Gateway Space

Constraints:

Gateway Registration Policy

Policy which handles the logic of gateway registration and if enough stake is present. The gateway is also added to the global state if it is approved.

Preceded By:

1. Gateway Registration

Domain Spaces:

1. Gateway Registration Space

Followed By:

1. Modify Gateway POKT Holdings

2. Modify Gateway Stake

3. Add New Gateway

Codomain Spaces:

1. Modify Gateway POKT Space

2. Modify Gateway POKT Space

3. Gateway Registration Space

Constraints:

Gateway Unregistration Policy

Policy which handles the logic of gateway unregistration process. It will set the stake status and remove any references to the gateway in terms of delegation.

Preceded By:

1. Gateway Unregistration

1. Gateway Unregistration Space

Followed By:

1. Update Gateway Stake Status

2. Remove Gateway Delegator

Constraints:

Burn Per Relay Policy

The policy for determining the amount to be burned per relay. At current time there will be 0 burn but this may change in the future to move towards deflation.

Preceded By:

1. Servicer Relay Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Servicer Relay Space

Followed By:

1. Burn POKT Mechanism

2. Modify Application Stake

Codomain Spaces:

1. Burn POKT Mechanism Space

2. Modify Application POKT Space

Constraints:

Burn Per Session Policy

The policy for determining the amount to be burned for session initiation.

Preceded By:

1. Submit Relay Request Policy

2. Submit Relay Request (Gateway) Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Submit Relay Request Space

Followed By:

1. Burn POKT Mechanism

2. Modify Application Stake

Mechanisms

Modify Gateway Stake

The mechanism to update the stake of a gateway

Preceded By:

1. Servicer Relay Policy

2. Gateway Registration Policy

3. Return Gateway Stake Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Modify Gateway POKT Space

State Updates:

1. Gateway.Staked POKT

Constraints:

Logic:

The gateway at DOMAIN[0].gateway_address has its stake modified by DOMAIN[0].value

Modify Application Stake

The mechanism to update the stake of an application

Preceded By:

1. Servicer Relay Policy

2. Burn Per Relay Policy

3. Application Stake Policy

4. Return Application Stake Policy

5. Burn Per Session Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Modify Application POKT Space

State Updates:

1. Application.Staked POKT

Constraints:

Logic:

The servicer at DOMAIN[0].application_address has its stake modified by DOMAIN[0].value

Increase Relay Fees

The mechanism which tracks the relay fees

Preceded By:

1. Servicer Relay Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Increase Relay Fees Space

State Updates:

1. Global.Relay Fees

Constraints:

Logic:

The relay fees increase by the POKT amount

Remove Session

The mechanism which removes a session from the global state.

Preceded By:

1. Servicer Relay Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Servicer Relay Space

State Updates:

1. Global.Sessions

Constraints:

Logic:

The session from DOMAIN[0] is removed from the global session state.

Update Gateway Stake Status

The mechanism for updating gateway stake status

Preceded By:

1. Gateway Unregistration Policy

2. Return Gateway Stake Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Servicer Stake Status Space

State Updates:

1. Gateway.Stake Status

Constraints:

Logic:

The gateway at DOMAIN[0].gateway_address has its stake status updated to DOMAIN[0].status

Modify Gateway POKT Holdings

The mechanism to update the personal holdings of a gateway

Preceded By:

1. Gateway Registration Policy

2. Return Gateway Stake Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Modify Gateway POKT Space

State Updates:

1. Gateway.POKT Holdings

Constraints:

Logic:

The gateway at DOMAIN[0].gateway_address has its POKT Holdings modified by DOMAIN[0].value

Update Application Delegate

The mechanism which updates delegate gateway that can act on its behalf.

Preceded By:

1. Application Delegate to Gateway Policy

2. Application Undelegate to Gateway Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Application Delegate to Gateway Space

State Updates:

1. Application.Delegate

Constraints:

Logic:

Set the delegate mechanism for the application at DOMAIN[0].application_public_key to DOMAIN[0].gateway_public_key

Add Gateway Delegator

The mechanism which adds an application that the gateway is a delegator for.

Preceded By:

1. Application Delegate to Gateway Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Application Delegate to Gateway Space

State Updates:

1. Gateway.Delegators

Constraints:

Logic:

Append the application at DOMAIN[0].application_public_key to the delegators attribute for the gateway at DOMAIN[0].gateway_public_key

Add New Gateway

The mechanism for adding a new gateway to the global state

Preceded By:

1. Gateway Registration Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Gateway Registration Space

State Updates:

1. Global.Gateways

Constraints:

Logic:

The gateway at DOMAIN[0].gateway_address is added to the global state

Remove Gateway Delegator

The mechanism which removes an application that the gateway is a delegator for.

Preceded By:

1. Application Undelegate to Gateway Policy

2. Gateway Unregistration Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Application Undelegation Space

State Updates:

1. Gateway.Delegators

Constraints:

Logic:

Remove the application at DOMAIN[0].application_public_key from the delegators attribute for the gateway at DOMAIN[0].gateway_public_key

Create New Session

The mechanism which creates and adds a new session with which servicers will do relays on.

Preceded By:

1. Submit Relay Request Policy

2. Submit Relay Request (Gateway) Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Submit Relay Request Space

State Updates:

1. Global.Sessions

Constraints:

Logic:

Take DOMAIN[0] and create a new session, then append to the global state.

Burn POKT Mechanism

The mechanism which has the protocl burning POKT

Preceded By:

1. Burn Per Relay Policy

2. Jail Node Policy

3. Servicer Forced Unstake Policy

4. Burn Per Session Policy

5. Assign Servicer Salary Policy

6. Burn POKT Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Burn POKT Mechanism Space

State Updates:

1. Global.Floating Supply

Constraints:

Logic:

The floating supply decreases by the POKT amount
